paragraphs.content: Psalm 106
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 106

paragraphs.content: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Praise ye the Lord. O give thanks unto the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

paragraphs.content: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who can utter the mighty acts of the Lord? who can shew forth all his praise?

paragraphs.content: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

paragraphs.content: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember me, O Lord, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

paragraphs.content: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

paragraphs.content: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

paragraphs.content: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

paragraphs.content: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

paragraphs.content: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

paragraphs.content: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

paragraphs.content: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

paragraphs.content: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:
paragraphs.contentHtml: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

paragraphs.content: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

paragraphs.content: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

paragraphs.content: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

paragraphs.content: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

paragraphs.content: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

paragraphs.content: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

paragraphs.content: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;
paragraphs.contentHtml: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

paragraphs.content: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

paragraphs.content: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

paragraphs.content: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

paragraphs.content: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

paragraphs.content: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

paragraphs.content: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

paragraphs.content: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

paragraphs.content: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

paragraphs.content: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

paragraphs.content: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
paragraphs.contentHtml: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

paragraphs.content: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

paragraphs.content: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:
paragraphs.contentHtml: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the Lord commanded them:

paragraphs.content: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

paragraphs.content: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

paragraphs.content: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

paragraphs.content: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

paragraphs.content: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

paragraphs.content: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore was the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

paragraphs.content: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

paragraphs.content: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

paragraphs.content: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

paragraphs.content: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

paragraphs.content: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

paragraphs.content: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.
